title.native: ティアムーン帝国物語～断頭台から始まる、姫の転生逆転ストーリー～
title.romaji: Tearmoon Teikoku Monogatari: Dantoudai kara Hajimaru, Hime no Tensei Gyakuten Story

description:
Twenty-year-old Princess Mia of the Tearmoon Empire, often scorned as the "selfish princess," was executed by guillotine in a rebellion. Next thing she knew, she awoke in her own twelve-year-old body, with her own blood-stained diary that she kept before she was beheaded sitting next to her pillow. Given a second chance at life, Mia decides to rebuild the empire. For the sake of Tearmoon's future? To save the people from starvation? For all the soldiers who lost their lives in the civil war? No! Everything she does in this life is for the sake of avoiding the guillotine! "F-For me, this should be a piece of cake!" Thus the useless, cowardly, self-serving princess brings about miracle after miracle in her great struggle to save herself in this altered-history fantasy.

(Source: Crunchyroll)
synonyms: บันทึกเรื่องราวจักรวรรดิเทียร์มูน: จุดพลิกผันชะตากรรมของเจ้าหญิงเริ่มจากบนกิโยติน
Hikayat Kekaisaran Tearmoon ~Cerita Putri yang Reinkarnasi ke Masa Lalu Dimulai dari Hukuman Penggal~

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.name: Royal Affairs
tags.description: Features nobility, alliances, arranged marriage, succession disputes, religious orders and other elements of royal politics.

tags.name: Age Regression
tags.description: Prominently features a character who was returned to a younger state.

tags.name: Conspiracy
tags.description: Contains one or more factions controlling or attempting to control the world from the shadows.

tags.name: Ojou-sama
tags.description: Features a wealthy, high-class, oftentimes stuck up and demanding female character.

tags.name: Shoujo
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult females.

tags.name: Reincarnation
tags.description: Features a character being born again after death, typically as another person or in another world.

tags.name: Politics
tags.description: Centers around politics, politicians, or government activities.

tags.name: Villainess
tags.description: Centers around or prominently features a villainous noble lady.

tags.name: Economics
tags.description: Centers around the field of economics.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Kingdom Management
tags.description: Characters in these series take on the responsibility of running a town or kingdom, whether they take control of an existing one, or build their own from the ground up.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

node.description: [Blog](http://blog.livedoor.jp/motitukinozomu/) | [Syosetu](https://mypage.syosetu.com/822896/)
[Blog](https://blog.naver.com/gilse1024) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Gilse1024) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/702789)
[Twitter](https://x.com/ibe_puniru)

[Website](http://hitodama.info/) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/hitodama1103/)

A Japanese singer, songwriter, radio personality and scriptwriter.

She has released 17 singles and 11 albums since her debut as a 13-year-old in 1994. Several of her songs have been used as anime theme songs. She is often mistaken for a voice actress because she is in the same field of activity as idol-esque voice actresses. When she is working as a screenwriter, she goes by the name Deko Akao, an alias made up from her senior [Satoru Akahori](https://anilist.co/staff/97460/)'s name.

Mother of a son and twin daughters.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/大塚舞)

Originating from [Shaft](https://anilist.co/studio/44/). Currently freelance.

Aspired to become an animator after having seen [Densetsu no Yuusha Da Garn](https://anilist.co/anime/2803/).
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kojiloveless)

__[Website](http://sonodakentaro.com/)__ Birthplace: Kumamoto Prefecture, Japan Instrument(s): vocal, guitar, bass and drums __Sonoda Kentarou__ is a Japanese lyricist, composer, arranger, singer and songwriter.

Website | Twitter Introduction Masayoshi Ooishi is a Japanese vocalist, lyricist, composer, arranger and guitarist. He is currently a lead vocalist and guitarist for the band Sound Schedule, which is a three-piece J-pop/rock/jazz band. He is also a part of the duo [OxT](https://anilist.co/staff/127401/OxT) (Ooishi x Tom-H@ck), with Oshima Tomohiro. Biography Since making his major debut as a vocalist and guitarist for the band Sound Schedule in 2001, he has left numerous works as a musician. His outstanding voice, which has revealed itself to be capable of touching the hearts of many, worldwide, and while having his performance evaluated by the people, as a part of a new band at the time, he got to appear on music-themed programs on TV, and on numerous unusual music stations, while also participating in festivals nationwide. In 2008, he made his solo debut as "Masayoshi Ooishi". His way of playing the acoustic guitar was said to be a masterpiece of its own, and as a solo artist to debut with that as a reputation, it made it all the more interesting for him. There are various ways to describe him as a musician, some call him a "hand magician", or a "one-person amusement park", some even say it's like watching a magic trick. Not only does he perform live at the country's floorboard, he also performs on the internet on sites such as YouTube and Nico Nico Douga, where he attracts lots of attention from all generations alike, but he's a lot more popular with the younger generation.

Website | Twitter Introduction Masayoshi Ooishi is a Japanese vocalist, lyricist, composer, arranger and guitarist. He is currently a lead vocalist and guitarist for the band Sound Schedule, which is a three-piece J-pop/rock/jazz band. He is also a part of the duo [OxT](https://anilist.co/staff/127401/OxT) (Ooishi x Tom-H@ck), with Oshima Tomohiro. Biography Since making his major debut as a vocalist and guitarist for the band Sound Schedule in 2001, he has left numerous works as a musician. His outstanding voice, which has revealed itself to be capable of touching the hearts of many, worldwide, and while having his performance evaluated by the people, as a part of a new band at the time, he got to appear on music-themed programs on TV, and on numerous unusual music stations, while also participating in festivals nationwide. [Twitter](https://twitter.com/uesaka_official) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/uesaka_sumire) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/c/uesakasumire) | [LINE Blog](https://lineblog.me/uesaka_sumire/) | [Record Label Profile](http://king-cr.jp/artist/uesakasumire/)

Sumire entered the entertainment industry at the age of 9, when she was scouted by Space Craft's junior talent division. In 2009, she landed her first regular radio gig as host of Web Raji@Dengeki Bunko, and in 2011, she transferred to animation division of Space Craft due her interest in becoming a voice actress. On March 12, 2016, Sumire received the Best Rookie Actress award in the 10th Seiyuu Awards. She has also been a member of the seiyuu unit ".lady." since 2014.

Sumire is fluent in Russian and loves the Soviet culture, which she became interested in after hearing the State Anthem of the USSR in her first year of high school. In April 2010, Sumire entered the Faculty of Foreign Studies at Sophia University, and she majored in the Russian language there.

Sumire is interested in history and war figurines, particularly Russian/Soviet history, the Showa era, and likes the book Romance of the Three Kingdoms. She also has had a strong interest in games, anime and manga ever since she was a child. Her other interests consists of photography, lolita fashion-- she works as a lolita model-- and drawing, which she is quite good at. She also loves rock and heavy metal; her favorite bands are Metallica, Judas Priest, Black Sabbath, Dragonforce, and Kinniku Shoujo Tai. Additionally, Sumire is very good friends with fellow seiyuu [Sachika Misawa](https://anilist.co/staff/102337/Sachika-Misawa), who has called Sumire "her waifu".

**Non-anime roles:**
- Rosalie - Memento Mori (VG)
- Exia - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Drake - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)

__[Website](http://www.kanoerana.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kanoerana7) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kanoerana/) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/kanoerana) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCDKCyrXCr1W4zE-lOw7YBRQ) | [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@kanoerana)__

__KanoeRana__ is a Japanese vocalist and lyricist under record labels KABECHORO (2018–) and KURAMAE RECORDS (2019–), having previously been under TAISUKE RECORDS (2015–2016) and Warner Music Japan (2016–2018). She made her first major debut on August 31, 2016, when she released her first mini album titled Kanoe Sanjou.

She currently actively releases small songs and covers to both her twitter and tiktok, which have made her quite renown in recent times.
